com.secarta.httpsec
Class Primitives

java.lang.Object
  com.secarta.httpsec.Primitives

public final class Primitives
extends java.lang.Object

HTTPsec/1.0 primitives. This class can be configured using a file "Primitives.conf" in the same directory as the distribution jar file, or in WEB-INF in a webapp. See that file for details.

hash

public static final byte[] hash(byte[] data)
Hash.

Parameters:
data - A byte array to hash.
Returns:
A byte array containing the hash of the input.

hashhash

public static final byte[] hashhash(byte[] data)
Hash something twice. A little bit faster than hash( hash( data ) ). Maybe.

Parameters:
data - A byte array to hash twice.
Returns:
A byte array containing the hash of the hash of the input.

hmac

public static final byte[] hmac(byte[] key,
                                byte[] data)
Calculate an hmac of the input using a secret key.

Parameters:
key - A byte array containing a secret key.
data - The data of which to calculate the hmac.
Returns:
A byte array containing the hmac of data using key.

                                   byte[] data)

Parameters:
key - The public key.
data - The data to encrypt.
Returns:

decrypt

public static final byte[] decrypt(java.security.PrivateKey key,
                                   byte[] data)
                            throws HttpsecException
Decrypt some ( hopefully ) encrypted data using a private key.

Parameters:
key - The private key.
data - The data to decrypt.
Returns:
A byte array containing the decrypted data.
Throws:
HttpsecException - if the input cannot be successfully decrypted.

sign

public static final byte[] sign(java.security.PrivateKey key,
                                byte[] data)
Calculate a signature over some data using a private key.

Parameters:
key - The private key.
data - The data to be signed.
Returns:
A byte array containing the signature over data using key.

verify

public static final boolean verify(java.security.PublicKey key,
                                   byte[] signature,
                                   byte[] data)
Verifies the signature of some data.

Parameters:
key - The public key.
signature - The purported signature over data.
data - The data over which you think the signature was calculated.
Returns:
true if signature was really calculated over data using the private key that goes with key. false if not.

getStreamCipher

public static final javax.crypto.Cipher getStreamCipher(int mode,
                                                        byte[] key,
                                                        long count)
Creates and initializes a Cipher object for ciphering a message body.

Parameters:
mode - Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE or Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE
key - The cipher key.
count - The count for the message being ciphered.
Returns:
A Cipher initialized with an initialization-vector created from count.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If anything goes wrong initializing the cipher. Nothing should.

rnd

public static final byte[] rnd(int length)
Produces length bytes of random flavoured algorithm food.

Parameters:
length - The number of bytes to produce.
Returns:
A byte array length bytes long.

Generate a public key pair.

Returns:
A java.security.KeyPair.

generateDHKeyPair

public static final java.security.KeyPair generateDHKeyPair(javax.crypto.spec.DHParameterSpec dhParams)
Generate a Diffie-Hellman key pair.

Parameters:
dhParams - The Diffie-Hellman parameters to use for the new key pair.
Returns:
A java.security.KeyPair.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are invalid.

generateDHKeyPair

public static final java.security.KeyPair generateDHKeyPair(java.lang.String group)
                                                     throws HttpsecException
Generate a Diffie-Hellman key pair using the parameters represented by group.

Parameters:
group - The symbolic name of a MODP group used by the HTTPsec/1.0 specification.
Returns:
A java.security.KeyPair.
Throws:
HttpsecException - if group does not represent a supported MODP group.

getDHGroup

public static final javax.crypto.spec.DHParameterSpec getDHGroup(java.lang.String group)
Look up the Diffie-Hellman parameters represented by group.

Parameters:
group - The MODP group to look up.
Returns:
A javax.crypto.spec.DHParameterSpec containing the MODP group, or null.

getDefaultDHGroup

public static final java.lang.String getDefaultDHGroup()
Returns:
The default MODP ( Diffie-Hellman parameters ) group name.

getDHAgreement

public static final byte[] getDHAgreement(java.security.PrivateKey mine,
                                          java.math.BigInteger yours)
Calculate a Diffie-Hellman shared secret.

Parameters:
mine - X, containing the agreement parameters.
yours - Y.
Returns:
A byte array containing a Diffie-Hellman shared secret.

fingerprint

public static final java.lang.String fingerprint(java.security.PublicKey key)
Calculate the "fingerprint" of a public key. The "fingerprint" is a string made up of hex couplets containing a hash of the X.509 DER encoded key data - using this library: Utils.hex( Primitives.hash( key.getEncoded() ) ).

Parameters:
key - The java.security.PublicKey to fingerprint.
Returns:
A String containing a fingerprint of the key.

fingerprint

public static final java.lang.String fingerprint(java.security.cert.Certificate cert)
Calculate a "fingerprint" of the public key contained in a certificate.

Parameters:
cert - The Certificate from which to extract the public key.
Returns:
A String containing the fingerprint of the public key in cert.

canonicalize

public static final java.lang.String canonicalize(java.lang.String v)
Canonicalizes an http header according to the HTTPsec/1.0 spec.

Parameters:
v - The header value to canonicalize.
Returns:
A String containing the canonicalized header value.
